programme.title: Wilson
programme.desc: Premiere. A lonely, neurotic middle-aged man reunites with his estranged wife and meets his teenage daughter for the first time. Comedy drama, starring Woody Harrelson, Sandy Oian-Thomas and Shaun Brown.

programme.title: The Free World
programme.desc: Premiere. A recently released ex-convict becomes involved with a woman married to an abusive husband. Drama, starring Elisabeth Moss, Waleed Zuaiter and Octavia Spencer.

programme.title: The Hurricane Heist: The Eye of the Storm
programme.desc: A special look at the latest Sky Cinema Original Film, a full-throttle disaster-heist thriller from The Fast and the Furious and XXX director Rob Cohen.

programme.title: Rough Stuff
programme.desc: Premiere. Activists make a deal with a treasure-seeking group to embark on an expedition through treacherous Australian terrain using modified four-wheel-drives. Adventure, starring Gareth Rickards, Vincent Andriano and Sam Glissan.

programme.title: The Emoji Movie
programme.desc: Premiere. In a world of living ideograms, multi-expressional emoji Gene embarks on a daring mission to find notorious hacker Jailbreak. Animated adventure, featuring the voices of TJ Miller, James Corden and Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: The Hurricane Heist
programme.desc: Premiere. Thieves attempt a major heist against the US Treasury as a Category 5 hurricane approaches one of its mint facilities. Action thriller, starring Toby Kebbell, Maggie Grace and Ryan Kwanten.

programme.title: The House
programme.desc: Premiere. Straight-laced suburbanite couple Scott and Kate Johansen set up an illegal casino when their daughter's scholarship falls through. Comedy, starring Will Ferrell, Amy Poehler and Jason Mantzoukas.

programme.title: Alien: Covenant
programme.desc: A crew of colonists sent to populate an alien planet have their mission diverted by a mysterious signal. After landing on a nearby world, they discover what became of the ill-fated Prometheus mission. Ridley Scott's sci-fi thriller, starring Katherine Waterston, Michael Fassbender and Danny McBride.

programme.title: Batman: The Killing Joke
programme.desc: The Dark Knight pursues his arch-enemy the Joker, who has escaped from Arkham Asylum. The Joker is haunted by the events that made him the man he is, and decides to launch a sadistic attack on those closest to Batman, with the intent of proving a cruel point about the line between good and evil. Animated comic-book thriller based on Alan Moore and Brian Bolland's graphic novel, with the voices of Kevin Conroy and Mark Hamill.

programme.desc: A look at Steven Spielberg's sci-fi adventure based on Ernest Cline's book, starring Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke and Ben Mendelsohn.(n)

programme.title: The Stanford Prison Experiment
programme.desc: A professor performs a social experiment designed to analyse abusive behaviour. He recruits 24 students and places them in a simulated prison, selecting some of the group to live as guards and some as convicts. The results take an unexpectedly terrifying turn, as power corrupts the guards and makes them indulge in sadistic behaviour. Fact-based drama, starring Billy Crudup and Ezra Miller.

programme.title: Nina
programme.desc: Troubled soul icon Nina Simone rediscovers the meaning of her life and work thanks to the support of loyal friend and assistant Clifton Henderson. Music biopic, starring Zoe Saldana, David Oyelowo and Mike Epps.

programme.title: Wuthering Heights
programme.desc: The head of a Yorkshire family takes in a mysterious boy, who is treated cruelly by the rest of the household but develops a close bond with his foster sister. Over the years to come as they both grow up, their relationship grows more intense, with devastating repercussions for all concerned. Period drama, based on Emily Bronte's novel, starring Ralph Fiennes and Juliette Binoche.

programme.title: Hello, Dolly
programme.desc: A widowed matchmaker sets about finding a new wife for a grain merchant whose spouse has died. However, she has secretly fallen in love with the man herself, and hatches an elaborate plan to marry him. Musical set in late 19th-century New York, starring Barbra Streisand, Walter Matthau, Michael Crawford and Marianne McAndrew, and featuring Louis Armstrong's performance of the title number.(c)

programme.title: The Doo Dah Man
programme.desc: A New Jersey college student running away from home finds himself travelling through the back roads of Texas with a con man who's just escaped from prison. Drama, starring Glenn Morshower, Will Brittain and Katherine Willis.(c)

programme.title: The Legend of Bagger Vance
programme.desc: The owner of an ailing golf club aims to raise money by drafting in a former golfing great and holding a high-stakes game. Unfortunately, the player soon realises his form is not what it was - but a mysterious caddy is on hand to dispense words of wisdom and common sense. Robert Redford's drama, starring Matt Damon, Will Smith and Charlize Theron.(c)

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: A smooth-talking chauffeur employs his natural charm to enjoy a string of casual liaisons with a host of women - but as he tires of his bed-hopping antics, he struggles to work out what is missing from his life. Comedy drama remake, starring Jude Law, Sienna Miller, Susan Sarandon and Marisa Tomei.(c)

programme.title: Miracles From Heaven
programme.desc: A sick young girl with a rare illness finds herself cured after surviving a terrible accident. Drama, starring Jennifer Garner, Kylie Rogers and Martin Henderson.(c)

programme.title: Cafe Society
programme.desc: In the 1930s, a Bronx youngster heads to Hollywood and falls for the beautiful secretary of his powerful agent uncle. Woody Allen's romantic comedy, starring Steve Carell, Jesse Eisenberg and Kristen Stewart.(c)

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
programme.desc: A tone deaf socialite has dreams of becoming a singer, but problems arise when she decides to perform at Carnegie Hall. Fact-based comedy, starring Meryl Streep.(c)

programme.title: Alfie
programme.desc: A smooth-talking chauffeur employs his natural charm to enjoy a string of casual liaisons with a host of women - but as he tires of his bed-hopping antics, he struggles to work out what is missing from his life. Comedy drama remake, starring Jude Law, Sienna Miller, Susan Sarandon and Marisa Tomei.(c)

programme.title: Queen Of Katwe
programme.desc: The life of a poor Ugandan youngster is changed forever when she is introduced to the game of chess. Drama, starring David Oyelowo, Lupita Nyong'o and Madina Nalwanga.(c)

programme.title: Meet Joe Black
programme.desc: Death takes over the body of a recently deceased young man, and embarks on a mission to claim the life of a powerful media tycoon, but ends up falling in love with his daughter instead - leaving him on the horns of a dilemma. Remake of 1934 romantic fantasy Death Takes a Holiday, starring Brad Pitt, Anthony Hopkins and Claire Forlani.(c)

programme.title: Rules Don't Apply
programme.desc: An aspiring actress and an ambitious young driver fall for one another while working for eccentric billionaire Howard Hughes. Romantic comedy, written, directed by and starring Warren Beatty, with Lily Collins, Haley Bennett and Alden Ehrenreich.(c)

programme.title: Away
programme.desc: In Blackpool, an unlikely friendship blossoms between a lonely, suicidal widower and a young woman trying to escape an abusive ex-boyfriend. Drama, starring Timothy Spall, Juno Temple and Matt Ryan.

programme.title: Life on the Line
programme.desc: The head of a power line team is sent in to fix the grid just as a huge storm hits Texas. True-life action thriller, starring John Travolta, Kate Bosworth and Sharon Stone.

programme.title: The Fisher King
programme.desc: A radio DJ contemplates suicide after a listener embarks on a murderous rampage in response to one of his broadcasts. He is saved by a now-homeless former professor of medieval history, who encourages him to retrieve what he claims is the Holy Grail. When the DJ later learns that he is responsible for his saviour's misfortunes, he feels compelled to make amends. Terry Gilliam's comedy drama, with Robin Williams, Jeff Bridges, Amanda Plummer and Mercedes Ruehl.

programme.title: The Zookeeper's Wife
programme.desc: A Warsaw animal lover risks her life by helping to shield hundreds of Jews from the Nazis. True-life drama, starring Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Bruhl.

programme.title: Crazy Heart
programme.desc: Washed-up country music star Bad Blake is heading for an early grave thanks to his alcoholic, chain-smoking lifestyle on the road. However, when he rides up to play a gig in Santa Fe, he encounters a journalist and single mother whose affection grants him a new lease of life. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Jeff Bridges, alongside Maggie Gyllenhaal, Colin Farrell and Jack Nation.

programme.title: Money Monster
programme.desc: A TV host and his producer are held hostage live on air by a man who lost everything after following their advice. Crime thriller, with George Clooney and Julia Roberts.

programme.title: Collateral Beauty
programme.desc: When a New York executive tips into depression, his scheming partners plan to use his letters to Love, Time and Death against him. Fantasy drama, with Will Smith, Edward Norton and Helen Mirren.

programme.title: The Zookeeper's Wife
programme.desc: A Warsaw animal lover risks her life by helping to shield hundreds of Jews from the Nazis. True-life drama, starring Jessica Chastain, Johan Heldenbergh and Daniel Bruhl.

programme.title: Crazy Heart
programme.desc: Washed-up country music star Bad Blake is heading for an early grave thanks to his alcoholic, chain-smoking lifestyle on the road. However, when he rides up to play a gig in Santa Fe, he encounters a journalist and single mother whose affection grants him a new lease of life. Drama, starring an Oscar-winning Jeff Bridges, alongside Maggie Gyllenhaal, Colin Farrell and Jack Nation.

programme.title: Superbad
programme.desc: Two teenage friends are on the brink of going to different colleges, so decide to mark the event by going to a party where they hope to lose their virginity. However, they have promised to supply the booze for the event, a task that proves much harder than expected because they are under age. Unfortunately, when a friend steps in to help, the situation gets even worse. Comedy, starring Jonah Hill, Michael Cera and Christopher Mintz-Plasse.

programme.title: Year One
programme.desc: An inept hunter and his shy gatherer sidekick are kicked out of their tribe and left to wander the Old Testament world. Blundering through several key moments of the Bible, they eventually end up at Sodom, where they must try and rescue their people from slavery. Comedy, starring Jack Black, Michael Cera, Oliver Platt and Hank Azaria.

programme.title: The Night is Young
programme.desc: On a booze-fuelled night out, two pairs of downtrodden friends discover that Los Angeles might not be as bad they'd always assumed. Comedy, starring Matt Jones, Dave Hill and Kelen Coleman.

programme.title: Police Academy 6: City Under Siege
programme.desc: The clueless cops return yet again, this time to thwart the machinations of a crime lord behind a wave of raids and robberies in the city. Unfortunately, they are unaware Mr Big is always one step ahead thanks to a police informer. Penultimate entry in the comedy series, starring Bubba Smith, David Graf, Michael Winslow, Matt McCoy and Leslie Easterbrook.

programme.title: Turner & Hooch
programme.desc: A Californian detective investigating the murder of a local man by drug smugglers has only one witness to help him solve the case - the large, smelly dog that belonged to the victim, which is about to turn the detective's well-ordered existence into chaos. Family comedy, starring Tom Hanks, Mare Winningham and Craig T Nelson.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rival's crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: A rich high-school student uses all her charm and financial clout to boost an awkward new pupil's image, but soon finds she has created a monster - while her own popularity suffers in the process. Comedy inspired by Jane Austen's Emma, starring Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: Two black male FBI agents pose as white female debutantes in the line of duty, donning full drag and very heavy make-up in an audacious bid to infiltrate a kidnapping ring. Comedy, starring brothers Shawn and Marlon Wayans, with Jaime King and Frankie Faison.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Baby
programme.desc: After a pair of one-night stands, the now single Bridget Jones winds up pregnant. Is the dad old flame Mark Darcy or US dating guru Jack Qwant? Comedy sequel, starring Renee Zellweger, Colin Firth and Patrick Dempsey.

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: A teenager is surprised when she is befriended by the girls in the most popular clique at her new school. However, a dating mishap leads to trouble and her supposed friends start to turn on her. Urged on by other pals outside their circle, the newcomer resolves to bring down the self-appointed queen of campus - only to end up adopting some of her rival's crueller characteristics. Comedy, with Lindsay Lohan, Rachel McAdams, Tina Fey and Lacey Chabert.

programme.title: Clueless
programme.desc: A rich high-school student uses all her charm and financial clout to boost an awkward new pupil's image, but soon finds she has created a monster - while her own popularity suffers in the process. Comedy inspired by Jane Austen's Emma, starring Alicia Silverstone, Stacey Dash, Brittany Murphy and Paul Rudd.

programme.title: White Chicks
programme.desc: Two black male FBI agents pose as white female debutantes in the line of duty, donning full drag and very heavy make-up in an audacious bid to infiltrate a kidnapping ring. Comedy, starring brothers Shawn and Marlon Wayans, with Jaime King and Frankie Faison.

programme.title: Bridget Jones's Baby
programme.desc: After a pair of one-night stands, the now single Bridget Jones winds up pregnant. Is the dad old flame Mark Darcy or US dating guru Jack Qwant? Comedy sequel, starring Renee Zellweger, Colin Firth and Patrick Dempsey.

programme.title: Raising Arizona
programme.desc: A habitual thief and his cop wife are distraught to discover they cannot have children, so set out to kidnap one of five babies born to a local tycoon. However, a relentless bounty hunter is soon on their trail, while two escaped convicts hope to get a reward for returning the child. Coen brothers comedy, starring Nicolas Cage, Holly Hunter, John Goodman and Frances McDormand.

programme.title: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
programme.desc: A series of sketches examining mankind's secrets and taboos through the trials of life from conception to death. Surreal comedy, starring the Python team of Michael Palin, Graham Chapman, John Cleese, Eric Idle, Terry Jones and Terry Gilliam. Featuring introductory short film The Crimson Permanent Assurance.

programme.title: Ibiza Undead
programme.desc: All hell breaks loose when a shady Ibiza club owner decides to spice up his shows by smuggling in undead performers. British horror-comedy, starring Cara Theobold, Emily Atack and Matt King.

programme.title: Rampage: Special
programme.desc: Preview of Dwayne Johnson's new big-screen adventure about a troop of intelligent gorillas tearing across North America, destroying everything in their path.

programme.title: Wild Oats
programme.desc: When a woman wrongly receives millions of dollars in life insurance, her best friend convinces her to take off and spend it. Comedy, starring Shirley MacLaine, Jessica Lange and Billy Connolly.

programme.title: In & Out
programme.desc: An Oscar-winning actor announces on national TV that his former schoolteacher is gay, causing uproar in the close-knit community where he grew up, and forcing the beleaguered tutor to convince his family, fiancee and pupils that he is straight. Comedy, starring Kevin Kline, Matt Dillon, Tom Selleck and Joan Cusack.

programme.title: Ghost Town
programme.desc: A bad-tempered dentist has a near-death experience and finds himself able to see ghosts. He is irritated to find that all the spirits need him to sort out their unresolved problems from when they were alive, particularly a man who wants the grouchy dentist to stop his widow from remarrying. Comedy, starring Ricky Gervais, Greg Kinnear and Tea Leoni.

programme.title: The Cable Guy
programme.desc: A man makes the mistake of engaging a cable TV installer in conversation in a ploy to get all the channels for free. However, the manic repairman shows an invincible determination to be his new best friend - and does not take kindly to rejection. Comedy directed by Ben Stiller, starring Jim Carrey, Matthew Broderick and George Segal.

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Joneses
programme.desc: A normal suburban couple discover their seemingly perfect neighbours are undercover spies. Action comedy, starring Zach Galifianakis, Jon Hamm and Wonder Woman's Gal Gadot.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse delays proposing to his girlfriend until he has won the approval of her strict father, a former CIA agent who does not suffer fools gladly, and vows to be on his best behaviour during a visit to her family home. However, his efforts to impress soon collapse into a catalogue of disasters. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Owen Wilson.

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: Disgraced entrepreneur Michelle Darnell attempts to launch a comeback with the reluctant help of Claire Rawlings, her former PA. Comedy, starring Melissa McCarthy, Kristen Bell and Peter Dinklage.

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: After accidentally knocking Kate Moss into the Thames, hapless champagne-swigging friends Patsy and Edina are hounded by the paparazzi. Comedy based on the BBC sitcom, starring Jennifer Saunders, Joanna Lumley and Julia Sawalha.

programme.title: Meet the Parents
programme.desc: A male nurse delays proposing to his girlfriend until he has won the approval of her strict father, a former CIA agent who does not suffer fools gladly, and vows to be on his best behaviour during a visit to her family home. However, his efforts to impress soon collapse into a catalogue of disasters. Comedy, starring Robert De Niro, Ben Stiller, Teri Polo, Blythe Danner and Owen Wilson.

programme.title: Keeping Up with the Joneses
programme.desc: A normal suburban couple discover their seemingly perfect neighbours are undercover spies. Action comedy, starring Zach Galifianakis, Jon Hamm and Wonder Woman's Gal Gadot.

programme.title: Pretty in Pink
programme.desc: Misfit high-school girl Andie Walsh unexpectedly attracts the attentions of a rich, popular boy, but the course of true love runs far from smoothly when their two worlds collide. Romantic drama, starring Molly Ringwald, Andrew McCarthy, James Spader, Jon Cryer and Harry Dean Stanton.(n)

programme.title: Balls of Fury
programme.desc: A table tennis champion's life falls apart after defeat at the Olympics. However, he gets the chance to redeem himself and get revenge when the FBI recruits him to infiltrate a secret underground ping-pong tournament run by an elusive criminal genius. Comedy sending up kung fu movies, starring Dan Fogler, Christopher Walken and Maggie Q.(n)

programme.title: Whisky Galore
programme.desc: Scottish islanders try to get their hands on the shipload of booze that washes up on their shores. Comedy, starring James Cosmo, Eddie Izzard and Naomi Battrick.(n)

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A by-the-book Los Angeles cop is paired with a laidback new partner to investigate the nefarious activities of a TV evangelist and a pornographic-magazine baron suspected of operating a criminal cult. Comedy spoof of the 1950s TV series, starring Dan Aykroyd, Tom Hanks, Christopher Plummer and the original show's star Harry Morgan.(n)

programme.title: The Top Ten Show
programme.desc: Which movies are doing the best business at home and across the pond? Clips from the UK and US Top Ten show you the best of what's on offer on the big screen.(n)

programme.title: Just Married
programme.desc: A newlywed couple are in for a rude awakening when they jet off on their dream honeymoon. They are looking forward to an enjoyable tour of Europe - but a series of chaotic events, plus the intervention of the bride's old flame, leaves them at each other's throats and their marriage in tatters. Romantic comedy, with Brittany Murphy, Ashton Kutcher, Christian Kane and David Moscow.(n)

programme.title: Loser
programme.desc: A hard-working college student is branded a loser by his roommates, who promptly oust him from their group. When he helps a girl deal with an unpleasant drugs-related experience, he falls madly in love with her - but she only has eyes for a professor. Comedy, starring Jason Biggs, Mena Suvari, Greg Kinnear, Zak Orth, Thomas Sadoski and Dan Aykroyd.(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: A single man realises he is in love with his best friend, but has never done anything about it out of a fear of commitment. Everything changes when she returns from a business trip to Scotland with a new fiance in tow, leaving him determined to make sure the wedding does not go ahead. Romantic comedy, starring Patrick Dempsey, Michelle Monaghan and Kevin McKidd.(n)

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: A slobbish guitarist dreams of stardom, but his hopes are dashed when the other members of his band kick him out. Struggling to make ends meet, he takes a job as a supply teacher at an exclusive private school, and sets about moulding his pupils into rock gods. Comedy from director Richard Linklater, starring Jack Black, Joan Cusack, Mike White and Sarah Silverman.(n)

programme.title: Fist Fight
programme.desc: A mild-mannered English teacher is challenged to an after-school scuffle by a fellow faculty member. Comedy, starring Charlie Day, Ice Cube and Tracy Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Miss Congeniality
programme.desc: A feminist FBI agent is sent undercover as a contestant in the Miss United States pageant when the event becomes the target of a terrorist bomb threat. As she is not exactly catwalk material, a veteran British coach is brought on board to oversee her transformation into a glamorous beauty queen. Comedy, starring Sandra Bullock, Michael Caine, Benjamin Bratt, Candice Bergen and William Shatner.(n)

programme.title: Made of Honor
programme.desc: A single man realises he is in love with his best friend, but has never done anything about it out of a fear of commitment. Everything changes when she returns from a business trip to Scotland with a new fiance in tow, leaving him determined to make sure the wedding does not go ahead. Romantic comedy, starring Patrick Dempsey, Michelle Monaghan and Kevin McKidd.(n)

programme.title: School of Rock
programme.desc: A slobbish guitarist dreams of stardom, but his hopes are dashed when the other members of his band kick him out. Struggling to make ends meet, he takes a job as a supply teacher at an exclusive private school, and sets about moulding his pupils into rock gods. Comedy from director Richard Linklater, starring Jack Black, Joan Cusack, Mike White and Sarah Silverman.(n)

programme.title: Fist Fight
programme.desc: A mild-mannered English teacher is challenged to an after-school scuffle by a fellow faculty member. Comedy, starring Charlie Day, Ice Cube and Tracy Morgan.(n)

programme.title: Election
programme.desc: A teacher develops an irrational dislike for an overambitious student and plans to sabotage her campaign for school president. He persuades a dim-witted athlete to stand, in the hope he will pip the high-achieving front-runner to the post - but the intervention of another student throws the plan into disarray. Satirical comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Reese Witherspoon, Chris Klein and Jessica Campbell.(n)

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: At the height of the Cold War, former superheroes driven into retirement by public outcry are confronted with the murder of one of their number. As they face the possibility of a conspiracy to eliminate them, they must contend with a world edging closer to the brink of nuclear war. Sci-fi drama, based on Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' graphic novel, starring Patrick Wilson, Jackie Earle Haley, Malin Akerman and Billy Crudup.

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: The caped crusader and his sidekick Robin discover that four of their worst enemies are now working together. The villains plan to use a machine that turns people into dust at a gathering of world leaders, allowing them to seize power. Comedy adventure based on the TV series, starring Adam West, Burt Ward, Burgess Meredith and Frank Gorshin.

programme.title: Pele: Birth Of A Legend
programme.desc: Biopic charting the meteoric rise of Brazilian football great Pele - from the slums of Sao Paulo to World Cup glory. Starring Kevin de Paula, Vincent D'Onofrio and Rodrigo Santoro.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: After being sentenced to death, murder suspect Callum Lynch enters a virtual world in the search for a device that contains genetic code for free will. Video game adaptation, starring Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons and Brendan Gleeson.

programme.title: X-Men Origins: Wolverine
programme.desc: Years before he joins the superhero team, mutant Logan is a member of a top secret military unit, but quits because he cannot justify his squad's brutal methods. However, when the woman he loves is murdered by his psychotic brother, Logan returns to his old enemies for help in seeking revenge - and is offered the chance to become indestructible. Superhero adventure prequel, starring Hugh Jackman and Liev Schreiber.

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
programme.desc: Teenager Peter Parker, aka Spider-Man, must protect New York City from a menacing new villain, the Vulture. However, he does get a helping hand from Iron Man. Superhero adventure, starring Tom Holland, Michael Keaton and Robert Downey Jr.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: A clumsy teenager develops superhuman powers after a genetically engineered spider bites him. At first his fantastic skills delight him, but his elation is severely tempered by a family tragedy, prompting him to dedicate his talents to combating evil. However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.

programme.title: Pele: Birth Of A Legend
programme.desc: Biopic charting the meteoric rise of Brazilian football great Pele - from the slums of Sao Paulo to World Cup glory. Starring Kevin de Paula, Vincent D'Onofrio and Rodrigo Santoro.

programme.title: Assassin's Creed
programme.desc: After being sentenced to death, murder suspect Callum Lynch enters a virtual world in the search for a device that contains genetic code for free will. Video game adaptation, starring Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jeremy Irons and Brendan Gleeson.

programme.title: Spider-Man: Homecoming
programme.desc: Teenager Peter Parker, aka Spider-Man, must protect New York City from a menacing new villain, the Vulture. However, he does get a helping hand from Iron Man. Superhero adventure, starring Tom Holland, Michael Keaton and Robert Downey Jr.

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: A clumsy teenager develops superhuman powers after a genetically engineered spider bites him. At first his fantastic skills delight him, but his elation is severely tempered by a family tragedy, prompting him to dedicate his talents to combating evil. However, he faces a baptism of fire in the form of crazed villain the Green Goblin. Comic-book superhero adventure, with Tobey Maguire, Kirsten Dunst, Willem Dafoe, James Franco and Rosemary Harris.

programme.title: Kiss of the Dragon
programme.desc: A Chinese police officer travels to Paris in search of the head of an international drug ring. However, his target is a corrupt cop who promptly frames him for murder. Fighting to clear his name, he finds an unlikely ally in an American prostitute who offers to testify against the crooked detective in return for help in rescuing her daughter. Martial arts adventure, starring Jet Li and Bridget Fonda.

programme.title: Ninja Assassin
programme.desc: An orphan is raised by a secret society of assassins and trained to be the ultimate killing machine, but he rebels when they kill his childhood friend. When a detective on the trail of the order is marked for death, the fugitive comes to her aid and protects her from his rival ninjas. Action thriller, starring Rain and Naomie Harris.

programme.title: Sky Cinema Preview
programme.desc: Previews of the films now playing on the Sky Cinema channels, plus other highlights showing on Sky.

programme.title: Ghost Rider
programme.desc: Motorcycle stuntman Johnny Blaze sells his soul to diabolical Mephistopheles to save the life of his father. His bargain dooms him to pass each night as Ghost Rider, a demonic skeletal biker bound to take evil souls to Hell. However, conflict between Mephistopheles and his son offers Johnny the chance to win back his humanity. Fantasy thriller based on the comic-book, starring Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes and Wes Bentley.

programme.title: True Lies
programme.desc: A seemingly ordinary computer salesman leads a double life as a secret agent battling international terrorism. His naive wife is unaware of his dual employment, and goes in search of adventure - only to end up in the clutches of terrorists who have stolen a nuclear weapon. James Cameron's action comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Jamie Lee Curtis and Tom Arnold.

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: An Amazon princess leaves home to fight in the First World War. Aside from falling for the dashing pilot she helped save, Diana Prince realises there is more to the enemy than meets the eye. Fantasy adventure, starring Gal Gadot, Chris Pine and David Thewlis.

programme.title: John Wick: Chapter 2
programme.desc: When a scheming Italian crime lord holds him to a blood oath, reluctant hitman John Wick goes on another murderous rampage. Action sequel, starring Keanu Reeves, Riccardo Scamarcio and Ian McShane.

Leonidas, fearless king of Sparta, leads 300 of his finest warriors into battle against the vast invading armies of the ruler of the Persian empire. As the outnumbered Spartans fight for their country, his queen, Gorgo, tries to rally support for her husband at home. Fantasy action adventure based on Frank Miller and Lynn Varley's comic-book series, starring Gerard Butler, Lena Headey, Dominic West, David Wenham and Rodrigo Santoro.

His bargain dooms him to pass each night as Ghost Rider, a demonic skeletal biker bound to take evil souls to Hell. However, conflict between Mephistopheles and his son offers Johnny the chance to win back his humanity. Fantasy thriller based on the comic-book, starring Nicolas Cage, Eva Mendes and Wes Bentley.
