programme.title: Insidious
programme.desc: A family experience strange events in their house and become convinced it is haunted. However, after moving on, they find the dark forces have followed them and when their son mysteriously falls into a coma, they must find a way to get rid of the paranormal entities tormenting them. Horror, starring Patrick Wilson and Rose Byrne.

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: A cataclysm leaves prehistoric animals Manny, Sid and Diego lost at sea on a drifting iceberg. They try to find a way to return home, embarking on a journey that leads to an encounter with a ferocious band of piratical creatures. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary and Peter Dinklage.

programme.title: X-Men: Days of Future Past Interview Special
programme.desc: Hugh Jackman, James McAvoy and Ian McKellen discuss reprising their roles in the latest episode of the superhero saga.

programme.title: Shark Tale
programme.desc: Ambitious fish Oscar dreams of escaping his humdrum undersea life. His wish comes true when a gangster shark keen to escape a world of organised crime seeks his help in faking his own death. But Oscar soon finds himself out of his depth as his fearsome reputation gets out of control. Animated comedy, with the voices of Will Smith, Robert De Niro, Martin Scorsese, Renee Zellweger, Angelina Jolie and Jack Black.

programme.title: Shrek
programme.desc: Anti-social ogre Shrek resolves to stop an evil ruler from banishing fairy-tale characters to his swampland home. However, the reluctant hero ends up forced to rescue the beautiful Princess Fiona from a castle guarded by a dragon, aided only by a wisecracking donkey. Animated comedy, with the voices of Mike Myers, John Lithgow, Cameron Diaz, Eddie Murphy and Vincent Cassel.

programme.title: Speed 2: Cruise Control
programme.desc: Feisty heroine Annie and her new boyfriend Alex take a cruise in the Bahamas, but the trip becomes a nightmare when they discover a vengeful computer genius - a former employee laid off because of his terminal illness - is also on board. He has secretly programmed the ship to crash into an oil tanker while he steals a cache of diamonds from the cargo. Action thriller sequel, with Sandra Bullock, Jason Patric and Willem Dafoe.

programme.title: Dante's Peak
programme.desc: A vulcanologist's suspicions that a long-dormant volcano is about to erupt turn out to be true, prompting him to race against time to save the community standing in its way - and clash with local government officials weighing his predictions against the loss in tourism revenue. Disaster movie, starring Pierce Brosnan, Linda Hamilton, Elizabeth Hoffman and Charles Hallahan.

programme.title: Transformers: Dark of the Moon
programme.desc: The heroic autobots discover that a spaceship from their own planet crashed into the moon decades ago, carrying their former leader and an incredibly powerful device. They must fight to defend the human race as their enemies the decepticons plot to use this machine to rebuild their own world and destroy the Earth. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Shia LaBeouf, Josh Duhamel and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley.

programme.title: Tank 432
programme.desc: A squad of mercenaries comes under attack from an unknown enemy and seeks shelter in an abandoned tank. The soldiers soon find that the hatch has jammed behind them leaving them trapped inside. They discover a set of files containing a terrible secret that threatens them all. Horror, starring Rupert Evans and Michael Smiley.

programme.title: Monsieur Lazhar
programme.desc: A French-Canadian community is rocked by the unexpected suicide of a well-liked teacher. An Algerian immigrant offers his services as a substitute, and as he helps the children to deal with the tragedy, he also comes to terms with his own painful past. Comedy drama, starring Mohamed Fellag and Sophie Nelisse. In French, English and Arabic.

programme.title: BSL Zone
programme.sub-title: BSL Zone: Close Up - Rubbena Aurangzeb-Tariq
programme.desc: Tessa Padden meets Rubbena Aurangzeb-Tariq, a Deaf artist and an art psychotherapist.

programme.title: Holiday Inn
programme.desc: A song-and-dance man tires of the bright lights and retires to a farm, but boredom soon prompts him to dream up an ambitious plan for the place. Musical, featuring the classic song White Christmas, starring Bing Crosby, Fred Astaire and Virginia Dale.

programme.title: Support Your Local Sheriff
programme.desc: A drifter in need of money takes the job of sheriff in a small mining outpost, and chooses the town drunk to be his deputy. Events take a chaotic turn when a family of influential crooks decides to pull out all the stops to do away with the lawman. Comedy Western, starring James Garner, Joan Hackett, Jack Elam, Bruce Dern and Walter Brennan.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: The leaders of the tiny European duchy of Grand Fenwick decide to solve their bankruptcy problem by declaring war on the USA. They confidently expect to lose and thereby qualify for economic aid - but the plan takes an unexpected turn for the worse when the Americans surrender. Comedy, starring Peter Sellers in three roles, with Jean Seberg, William Hartnell, David Kossoff and Leo McKern.

programme.title: Damn the Defiant
programme.desc: The commander of a British warship fighting in the Napoleonic campaign faces bitter opposition from his right-hand man, a cruel and sadistic officer hated by the crew. In a battle of wills between the pair, the captain's second-in-command tries to provoke his leader's wrath by tormenting his son, an officer on the vessel. Drama, starring Alec Guinness, Dirk Bogarde and Anthony Quayle.

programme.title: Super 8
programme.desc: A boy and his friends sneak out at night to film an amateur zombie movie, only to witness a train derailment. As people start disappearing from their town and the military descends in force, they come to realise a dangerous alien was being transported on the train and is now on the loose. Sci-fi thriller, starring Joel Courtney and Elle Fanning.

programme.title: Journeyman Interview Special
programme.desc: Paddy Considine discusses his new boxing drama Journeyman, which he also wrote and directed.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Ghost Protocol
programme.desc: Secret agent Ethan Hunt and his team are implicated in a bombing at the Kremlin, forcing the American president to declare them fugitives. The spies plan to clear their name by abducting the real terrorist, which leads them into a pursuit around the globe. However, Hunt cannot be sure his colleagues are trustworthy. Action adventure sequel, starring Tom Cruise, Jeremy Renner, Simon Pegg and Paula Patton.

programme.title: Priest
programme.desc: In the future, the world has been devastated by a war between humans and vampires, leaving an enclave of survivors living under the domination of a religious hierarchy. A war veteran-turned-priest breaks his vows and sets off in search of his niece, who has been kidnapped by undead villains. Fantasy action thriller, with Paul Bettany, Karl Urban and Maggie Q.

programme.title: Howl's Moving Castle
programme.desc: A girl earns the enmity of a spiteful witch, and is placed under a curse that turns her into an old woman. Taking shelter in the walking castle of a famed wizard, she encounters the demon who enables the building to move, and who offers to dispel the enchantment - if she helps to free him. Spirited Away director Hayao Miyazaki's fantasy, based on Diana Wynne Jones' novel. With the voices of Chieko Baisho and Takuya Kimura. In Japanese.(n)

programme.title: Lord Jim
programme.desc: A 19th-century sailor is branded a coward after jumping ship during a terrifying storm. To repair his damaged reputation, he embarks on a perilous journey through the Far East to deliver a consignment of explosives to a tribe rebelling against the oppression of a feudal warlord. Adventure, based on Joseph Conrad's famous novel, starring Peter O'Toole, James Mason, Eli Wallach, Jack Hawkins and Curt Jurgens.(n)

programme.title: Angel and the Badman
programme.desc: A gunslinger determined to track down his father's killer is badly wounded and taken in by a Quaker family, whose daughter nurses him back to health. His attraction to the girl and growing respect for the family's peaceful way of life lead him to consider renouncing violence - but his desire for revenge proves hard to surrender. Western, starring John Wayne, Bruce Cabot and Gail Russell.(n)

programme.title: Voyage to the Bottom of the Sea
programme.desc: An admiral takes charge of an experimental submarine just as the world is plunged into catastrophe. A belt of radiation surrounding the planet has ignited, threatening all life on Earth. The admiral believes he can end the crisis with a well-aimed nuclear missile, but faces an uphill struggle to convince high command that his plan will not lead to more destruction. Sci-fi adventure, with Walter Pidgeon, Joan Fontaine and Robert Sterling.(n)

programme.title: The Book Thief
programme.desc: A girl separated from her family is raised by foster parents in Nazi Germany, who instill in her a love of reading. She is horrified by the book burnings and tries to save volumes from the flames, while she and her adoptive family provide a safe hiding place for a Jewish boy. Drama based on Markus Zusak's novel, starring Sophie Nelisse, Geoffrey Rush and Emily Watson.(n)

programme.title: Transporter 2
programme.desc: A retired former special forces agent has the job of chauffeuring the son of a controversial Miami politician. When Russian criminals kidnap the youngster and inject him with a virus in the hope of infecting his father, the driver sets out to find the boy and his abductors. Action thriller sequel, starring Jason Statham, Alessandro Gassman and Amber Valletta.(n)

programme.title: Shutter Island
programme.desc: A US marshal, traumatised by his past, heads to a hospital for the criminally insane on a remote island to investigate the disappearance of a woman who murdered her children. As the case unfolds, he begins to suspect the doctors are hiding something - and that a grisly fate awaits all the patients on a sinister ward. Martin Scorsese's mystery thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Mark Ruffalo and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Happy Days
programme.desc: Potsie organises a date to put a little sparkle into Richie's loveless life, but the lucky girl's reputation leaves a lot to be desired.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben starts to hunt animals for their skins to sell for profit. John-Boy organises a reenactment of a famous historical battle, leaving Grandpa ashamed, as he has exaggerated his own part in the actual event.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy takes in a runaway child fleeing from her abusive stepfather. However, Grandpa is suspicious of her story.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Doc Baker advertises for a partner to ease his workload, and the successful applicant turns out to be black - arousing bigotry among the townsfolk.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura is furious when a college teacher suggests her grades would improve significantly should she respond positively to his amorous advances.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd tries to help a hideously disfigured man, while Joanie excitedly makes preparations for her wedding. Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell star.

programme.title: Providence
programme.sub-title: It Was a Dark and Stormy Night
programme.desc: Syd begins to understand the source of Graham's unspeakable pain after she is stranded in a storm with him. Elsewhere, Joanie and Burt make an impulsive decision which ends in disaster. Melina Kanakardes stars.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy learns the sheriff is a war hero, but wants to forget the terrible things he witnessed during the conflict.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy is sent to report on the landing of the Hindenburg, but is traumatised when he witnesses its destruction and the deaths of many passengers.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason falls in love with Curt's sister, and neglects his studies to help her develop her musical talents. However, the relationship does not end well.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma is admitted to hospital, but Grandpa does not cope well with being away from her. Corabeth thinks Elizabeth is a bad influence on Aimee, and forbids them from being friends.

programme.title: Carolina Moon
programme.desc: A woman returns to her home town, where she discovers that the killer of her childhood friend is still terrorising the community, and embarks on a mission to track him down before he claims another life. However, while trying to capture the murderer, romance unexpectedly blossoms between her and the handsome older brother of her deceased friend. Romantic mystery, starring Claire Forlani and Oliver Hudson.

programme.title: Gettysburg
programme.desc: Fact-based drama recreating the battle of the American Civil War, where Union and Confederate forces fought for three days in Pennsylvania, a confrontation that would change the course of the war. Starring Tom Berenger, Martin Sheen, Jeff Daniels and Stephen Lang.

programme.title: Gettysburg
programme.desc: Fact-based drama recreating the battle of the American Civil War, where Union and Confederate forces fought for three days in Pennsylvania, a confrontation that would change the course of the war. Starring Tom Berenger, Martin Sheen, Jeff Daniels and Stephen Lang.

programme.title: Gettysburg
programme.desc: Fact-based drama recreating the battle of the American Civil War, where Union and Confederate forces fought for three days in Pennsylvania, a confrontation that would change the course of the war. Starring Tom Berenger, Martin Sheen, Jeff Daniels and Stephen Lang.

programme.title: A Perfect Tribute
programme.desc: A boy risks life and limb to travel across the war-torn southern states of America during the height of hostilities in the Civil War, hoping to visit his wounded brother in a field hospital on the other side of the country. Period drama, starring Jason Robards, Lukas Haas and Jose Ferrer.

programme.title: Revolution
programme.desc: A New York fur trapper leads a simple life until the outbreak of the American war of Independence. As he struggles to protect his son, who has been drafted into service, he forms a relationship with an aristocratic woman who has turned against the British. Historical drama, starring Al Pacino, Donald Sutherland and Nastassja Kinski.

programme.title: Revolution
programme.desc: A New York fur trapper leads a simple life until the outbreak of the American war of Independence. As he struggles to protect his son, who has been drafted into service, he forms a relationship with an aristocratic woman who has turned against the British. Historical drama, starring Al Pacino, Donald Sutherland and Nastassja Kinski.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: An investigation into the murder of a woman from the well-heeled Clydeside sailing fraternity reunites Matt Burke with an old flame. The victim's husband immediately falls under suspicion - but the discovery of two more bodies makes it clear there are other members of the seafaring set with blood on their hands.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia gets a job working for a dressmaker, but as her responsibilities grow, she starts to miss leading a simple life.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma organises a traditional quilting as Mary Ellen's birthday approaches, but Mary Ellen rejects the custom as demeaning to her.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The children put their lives in danger when they try to imitate the stunts of an ageing circus daredevil who arrives in Walnut Grove. Jack Kruschen guest stars.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Bungling crooks kidnap Mr Oleson, but Harriet refuses to pay the ransom, so he exacts revenge on her by helping his captors abduct more people.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Joanie withdraws from society as the full impact of the miscarriage takes hold, and Syd attempts to persuade a recluse to have plastic surgery when she discovers he is about to be evicted.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd tries to help the lighthouse keeper venture out after his plastic surgery, while Joanie drowns her sorrows with booze. Drama, starring Melina Kanakaredes.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan meets a teenager with a learning disability. who is living on the streets, and tries to find a family to take care of him.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.sub-title: Close Encounters of the Heavenly Kind
programme.desc: Jonathan offers encouragement to a bullied orphan who is in danger of being taken away from his grandfather.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's No Greater Love
programme.desc: A woman endures a seemingly endless series of personal trials and traumas after her parents are killed on the Titanic, but carries on struggling to keep her family together. Period drama, starring Kelly Rutherford, Chris Sarandon, Simon MacCorkindale and Michael Landes.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Zoya
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Russian aristocrat is forced by the Revolution into a life of poverty-stricken exile in Paris, where she falls for a handsome American soldier. The couple move to New York and seem set for a life of happiness - until the Wall Street Crash deals another devastating blow. Melodrama, based on Danielle Steel's novel, starring Melissa Gilbert, Bruce Boxleitner and Diana Rigg.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy must stand in for the town minister while he is away on honeymoon, but fears he has nothing profound to say.

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd continues to feel like her life is adrift after being banned from practicing medicine. Morgan Fairchild guest stars.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's No Greater Love
programme.desc: A woman endures a seemingly endless series of personal trials and traumas after her parents are killed on the Titanic, but carries on struggling to keep her family together. Period drama, starring Kelly Rutherford, Chris Sarandon, Simon MacCorkindale and Michael Landes.

programme.title: SOS Titanic
programme.desc: Recreation of the sinking of the luxury liner after a collision with an iceberg during its maiden voyage from Southampton to New York City in 1912, following various passengers including a newlywed couple and a group of Irish emigrants hoping to start new lives in America. Documentary-style drama, starring David Janssen, Cloris Leachman and Susan St James.

programme.title: Heaven & Hell: North & South, Book III
programme.desc: Historical drama set in the aftermath of the American Civil War. Starring Philip Casnoff, Kyle Chandler, Cathy Lee Crosby, Lesley-Anne Down and Jonathan Frakes.

programme.title: Titanic: Secrets Revealed
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the wreck of the famous liner, from the once-magnificent ballrooms and dining salon to the locked gates leading to the third-class passenger level.

programme.title: Britannic
programme.desc: A tenacious female British secret service agent is assigned to a liner carrying medical supplies during the First World War, to protect it from German saboteurs. On board, she becomes distracted by an unforeseen romance, but the hardening realisation that the enemy may have infiltrated the ship sharpens her focus once again, and she pulls out all the stops to unmask the suspected spy. Drama, with Amanda Ryan, Edward Atterton and Jacqueline Bisset.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandma rallies the community to save an old house from demolition, unaware that Grandpa has secured the contract to knock it down.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The newspaper where John-Boy works closes down, but the owner offers to sell him a printing press so he can publish one of his own. However, raising the money proves difficult.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles Ingalls rushes to Chicago to console a friend whose son is reported to have been killed in a road accident. Drama, starring Michael Landon.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The children make jokes about a new student's weight, but fail to understand how much they are upsetting him. Nancy takes advantage of his affection for her by making him her slave.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd meets a mysterious man who claims to be her father, while Jim treats a dog that refuses to eat. Melina Kanakaredes and Mike Farrell star.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd's love life improves after she meets a single father, but their relationship is shaken when she finds out he has a heart condition that causes him to have blackouts.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Mark gets a job working for a movie star who hates all men. They both wish they could trade places - only for their request to be granted.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan is reunited with his wife from his life as a human, and has to help her move on from him and make a fresh start.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Heartbeat
programme.desc: A pregnant TV producer, abandoned by her husband, falls for an equally lonely divorced colleague, but their romance is threatened by her inability to let go of the past. Drama, starring John Ritter, Polly Draper, Nancy Morgan and Kevin Kilner.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Zoya
programme.desc: The Wall Street Crash deals another devastating blow to exiled Russian aristocrat Zoya as she moves to New York with the handsome American soldier she met in Paris. Concluding part of the melodrama based on Danielle Steel's novel, starring Melissa Gilbert, Bruce Boxleitner and Diana Rigg.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy's dean asks him to take care of a 16-year-old genius college student for a weekend. The apparent genius is clearly gifted in all academic areas, but woefully lacking in social graces. Richard Thomas stars.(n)

programme.title: Providence
programme.desc: Syd goes to court as the medical malpractice trial finally gets under way, fearing her career as a physician may be over. A bored Joanie weighs up her options, and considers returning to college to add a little zest to her humdrum life. Drama, starring Melina Kanakarades and Mike Farrell.(n)

programme.title: Love Comes Softly
programme.desc: A widow enters into a temporary marriage of convenience, a practical arrangement to help a recently bereaved father care for his young daughter. However, when the time comes for her to leave, she realises circumstances and people have changed. Romantic drama set in 19th-century America, starring Katherine Heigl, Dale Midkiff, and Skye McCole Bartusiak.(n)

programme.title: Love's Unfolding Dream
programme.desc: A woman in 19th-century America aspires to be a doctor and her dreams seem to come true when she nurses a wealthy socialite who offers to pay for her to enrol at medical school. However, an unexpected encounter with a handsome lawyer forces her to reconsider what she really wants. Period drama, starring Scout Taylor-Compton, Nancy Linehan Charles and Patrick Levis.(n)

programme.title: Heaven & Hell: North & South, Book III
programme.desc: Historical drama set in the aftermath of the American Civil War. Starring Philip Casnoff, Kyle Chandler, Cathy Lee Crosby, Lesley-Anne Down and Jonathan Frakes.(n)

programme.title: The Makeover
programme.desc: Premiere. Hannah Higgins attempts to turn blue-collar Boston beer vendor Elliot Doolittle into a viable candidate. Comedy, starring Julia Stiles and David Walton.(n)

programme.title: Mary Higgins Clark: Before I Say Goodbye
programme.desc: A tenacious businesswoman sets out to refute allegations that her recently deceased husband was involved in all manner of dodgy deals - but a string of nasty shocks awaits her. Mystery, adapted from a novel by Mary Higgins Clark, starring Sean Young, Ursula Karven, Peter DeLuise and Aaron Douglas.(n)

programme.desc: A woman in 19th-century America aspires to be a doctor and her dreams seem to come true when she nurses a wealthy socialite who offers to pay for her to enrol at medical school. However, an unexpected encounter with a handsome lawyer forces her to reconsider what she really wants. Period drama, starring Scout Taylor-Compton, Nancy Linehan Charles and Patrick Levis.(n)

programme.title: Heaven & Hell: North & South, Book III
programme.desc: Historical drama set in the aftermath of the American Civil War. Starring Philip Casnoff, Kyle Chandler, Cathy Lee Crosby, Lesley-Anne Down and Jonathan Frakes.(n)

programme.title: The Makeover
programme.desc: Premiere. Hannah Higgins attempts to turn blue-collar Boston beer vendor Elliot Doolittle into a viable candidate. Comedy, starring Julia Stiles and David Walton.(n)

programme.title: Quaking Grass
programme.desc: Brandon seeks refuge after Jerrika kicks him out. A physically and mentally ailing Ronnie runs into Rafiq. Meanwhile, Quentin takes a valued item from Trice while Kevin's quest ends with Brandon making a bad deal with Reg.

credits.director: Graphic Language, Adult Content, Violence, Brief Nudity

programme.title: Before I Fall
programme.desc: Sam (Zoey Deutch) seems to have everything a teenage girl could want: popularity, a hot boyfriend, cool status, fun friends, loving family and seeming happiness. But beyond the superficial, Sam's life isn't so charmed. She is one of a clique of high school mean girls who make life hell for those who are different. When Sam is killed in a car accident, she is forced to relive her last day on Earth seven times in order to get things right. She attempts to make sense of what befell her and gain a better understanding of herself and others.

programme.title: Tie Goes to the Runner
programme.desc: Chuck receives a mandate from a new boss. Axe braves a difficult choice following his recent indictment. Taylor generates a monster strategy. Lara threatens to pull her money from Axe Capital. Sacker strives to prove herself as Chief of Crim. Season premiere.

programme.title: The Wrong Maria Gonzalez
programme.desc: Chuck tries to cash in a favor owed to him by an honorable judge. Axe orchestrates creative new avenues for conducting trades. Wendy helps Taylor weather their first major crisis. Connerty continues chasing down Ice Juice leads.(c)

programme.title: A Generation Too Late
programme.desc: Chuck faces a dilemma when he's given a perverse directive. Axe expands upon a secret venture. Taylor and Wags interview a different type of Axe Capital employee. Connerty and Dake close in on key witnesses in the Ice Juice sabotage. Axe and Lara consider an unexpected agreement.(c)

programme.title: Useful Idiot
programme.desc: Carrie has problems at home. Saul and Wellington work on Paley.(c)

programme.title: First Pitch
programme.desc: The President tries to prove he's a man's man by throwing out the first pitch at a Washington Nationals game, while Ivanka attempts to become a feminist icon by opening a school for girls. Mid-season finale.(c)

programme.title: Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: I'm Still Laughing
programme.desc: Comedian and actor Bill Bellamy hosts this installment of Shaquille O'Neal's comedy franchise. Featuring comedy veteran Bruce Bruce who teams up with Huggy Lowdown, Aida Rodriguez, and Brian "Da Wildcat" Smith.

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Life in 12 Bars
programme.desc: This documentary contextualizes Eric Clapton’s role in contemporary music and cultural history. Told through his own words, it reflects on his traumatic childhood, his difficult struggle with drugs and alcohol, the loss of his son and how he always found his inner strength and healing in music. It features extensive interviews with Clapton himself, along with his family, friends, musical collaborators, contemporaries and heroes – including late music icons B.B. King, Jimi Hendrix and George Harrison. Directed by Oscar winner Lili Fini Zanuck.

programme.title: Patriots Day
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombing, Police Sergeant Tommy Saunders (Mark Wahlberg) joins courageous survivors, first responders and investigators in a race against the clock to hunt down the bombers before they strike again. The stories of Special Agent Richard Deslauriers (Kevin Bacon), Police Commissioner Ed Davis (John Goodman), Sergeant Jeffrey Pugliese (J.K. Simmons) and nurse Carol Saunders (Michelle Monaghan) are all woven together to show the strength of the city.

programme.title: The Whole Nine Yards
programme.desc: Oz (Matthew Perry) is a miserable dentist living with Sophie (Rosanna Arquette), his shrew of a wife. Things get even worse when hitman Jimmy "The Tulip" (Bruce Willis) moves in next door. Sent by Sophie to Chicago to rat out Jimmy to the Gogalak gang, Oz meets and falls in love with Cynthia (Natasha Henstridge), Jimmy's estranged wife. Oz returns home only to discover Sophie's hired Jill (Amanda Peet), his perky dental hygienist, to kill him.

programme.title: A Dog's Purpose
programme.desc: A devoted dog (voiced by Josh Gad) finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he teaches to laugh and love. Also starring Dennis Quaid, Britt Robertson, K.J. Apa, Peggy Lipton and Pooch Hall.

programme.title: Queen of the Desert
programme.desc: Gertrude Bell (Nicole Kidman) rejects the stifling rigidity of life in turn-of-the-century England, leaving it behind for a chance to travel to Tehran. She begins her lifelong adventure across the Arab world, a journey marked by danger, a passionate affair with a British officer (James Franco), and an encounter with the legendary T.E. Lawrence (Robert Pattinson).

programme.title: Patriots Day
programme.desc: In the aftermath of the Boston Marathon bombing, Police Sergeant Tommy Saunders (Mark Wahlberg) joins courageous survivors, first responders and investigators in a race against the clock to hunt down the bombers before they strike again. Simmons) and nurse Carol Saunders (Michelle Monaghan) are all woven together to show the strength of the city.

programme.title: The Looking Glass War
programme.desc: The United States and Russia are locked in a dangerous new standoff. From Facebook and meddling in the 2016 election, to alleged poisoning attacks, to the war in Syria, Russia is the dominant force in our news cycle. John Heilemann, Mark McKinnon and new host Alex Wagner examine America’s new Cold War with Russia and where it’s leading. Season Premiere.(c)

programme.title: Single White Female
programme.desc: Hedy (Jennifer Jason Leigh) appears at the apartment of Allie (Bridget Fonda) just as she has thrown out her unfaithful boyfriend (Steven Weber). The surviving half of a set of twins, Hedy perpetually seeks someone to complete her, and sees in Allie everything she would like to be. Hedy moves not only into the apartment, but into the most personal aspects of Allie's life, including having her hair styled exactly to match her roommate's. When Allie reconciles with her boyfriend, the unspoken bargain between the women goes terrifyingly awry.

programme.title: In & Out
programme.desc: Welcome to Greenleaf, a picture-perfect Indiana town where the high school is the proud focus of attention. On the night of the Oscars telecast, the town's center of attention is Greenleaf teacher Howard Brackett when a former student, who's now a winning actor, tells the audience of millions that Howard is gay. Kevin Kline plays stunned Howard, who scrambles to go forth with his wedding to devoted Emily (Joan Cusack) and assert his manliness.

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).

programme.title: The Preacher's Wife
programme.desc: Denzel Washington stars as an angel named Dudley sent to Earth to help a minister's marriage (Courtney B. Vance) to his wife (Whitney Houston). Things take a twist when Dudley accidentally falls in love with her.

programme.title: G.I. Jane
programme.desc: Demi Moore stars as gutsy Lieutenant O'Neil, the first woman ever given the opportunity to earn a place in the armed forces most highly skilled combat unit - the elite Navy SEALS. But the already brutal rigors of training camp turn into an unimaginable test of courage and determination once it becomes clear that no one - not powerful politicians, top military brass, or her male Navy SEAL teammates - wants her to succeed!

programme.title: Wolves
programme.desc: Anthony (Taylor John Smith) is a standout player on his high school's basketball team with everything going for him: a killer three-point shot, a loving girlfriend (Zazie Beetz) and a chance at a scholarship to Cornell. But Anthony's dreams of playing college ball are jeopardized by his volatile father (Michael Shannon), a hard-drinking writer whose compulsive gambling threatens to derail the lives of both his wife (Carla Gugino) and son. Anthony must summon the strength to step out from his father's shadow and reclaim his future.

programme.title: Life Is Beautiful (La vita e bella)
programme.desc: Guido is a charming, bumbling Jewish waiter whose colorful imagination and playful spirit help him to woo a beautiful schoolteacher. The couple marries and has a young son, but before long, their idyllic world is threatened by Nazi soldiers who force the family into a concentration camp. Guido must now use his imagination again - this time to transform his son's tragic new surroundings into a magical wonderland.

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).

programme.title: Wolves

But Anthony's dreams of playing college ball are jeopardized by his volatile father (Michael Shannon), a hard-drinking writer whose compulsive gambling threatens to derail the lives of both his wife (Carla Gugino) and son. Anthony must summon the strength to step out from his father's shadow and reclaim his future.(n)

programme.title: Lord of War
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this drama thriller as Yuri Orlov, a Russian immigrant who becomes a millionaire in the Eighties and Nineties by reselling weapons from his politically crumbling homeland to "hot spot" regions around the world, all while marrying a beautiful woman (Bridget Moynahan), dodging a determined federal agent (Ethan Hawke), and occasionally facing the immorality of his chosen profession. Jared Leto and Ian Holm costar in this film from writer/director Andrew Niccol ("Gattaca," "The Truman Show").(n)

programme.title: Employee of the Month (2006)
programme.desc: A slacker box boy (Dane Cook) at a New Mexico superstore tries to impress a gorgeous new coworker (Jessica Simpson) by transforming himself into a model corporate drone, but runs up against the previous 17-time holder (Dax Shepard) of the store's "employee of the month" honor.(n)

programme.title: Surviving The Wild
programme.desc: Following the untimely death of his grandpa Gus (Jon Voight), thirteen-year-old Shaun (Aidan Cullen) disregards his parent's wishes and embarks on a journey with his dog Riley, to spread his grandpa's ashes in the wild. Throughout the journey, Shaun is guided by the spirit of his grandfather. Together they overcome challenge after challenge, as Shaun traverses white water rapids and tries to evade two crazed hillbillies that are on his tail.(n)

programme.title: Eric Clapton: Life in 12 Bars
programme.desc: This documentary contextualizes Eric Clapton’s role in contemporary music and cultural history. Told through his own words, it reflects on his traumatic childhood, his difficult struggle with drugs and alcohol, the loss of his son and how he always found his inner strength and healing in music. It features extensive interviews with Clapton himself, along with his family, friends, musical collaborators, contemporaries and heroes – including late music icons B.B. King, Jimi Hendrix and George Harrison. Directed by Oscar winner Lili Fini Zanuck.(n)

programme.title: Get The Gringo
programme.desc: An already bad day for Driver is not getting any better. He makes a big haul of millions that would give him a nice summer vacation on easy street, but it goes south - literally. During a high-speed car chase with the US Border Patrol and a bleeding body in his back seat, Driver flips his car smashing through the border wall, tumbling violently, coming to a stop in Mexico. Apprehended by the Mexican authorities, he is sent to a hard-core prison where he enters the strange and dangerous world of "El Pueblito". Starring Mel Gibson.(n)

programme.title: Amistad
programme.desc: This movie chronicles the journey of a group of enslaved Africans who overtake their captor's ship and attempt to return to their beloved homeland. When the ship is seized, the captives are brought to the United States where they are charged with murder and await their fate in prison. A courtroom battle ensues that captures the attention of the entire nation. For the men and woman on trial, it's simply a fight for the basic right of freedom. Directed by Steven Spielberg.(n)

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: Successful suburbanite commuter Howard Wakefield (Bryan Cranston) takes a perverse detour from family life by vanishing without a trace. Hidden in the attic of his carriage house garage and surviving by scavenging at night, Howard secretly observes the lives of his wife (Jennifer Garner) and children and neighbors. He slowly realizes that he has not left his family, he has left himself.(n)

programme.title: Cold Comes the Night
programme.desc: As the proprietor of a motel, Chloe is in financial trouble and has quietly allowed a prostitution operation to run on the premises. One night, Topo (Bryan Cranston), a nearly-blind career criminal, and his driver stop over at the motel while en route to deliver cash to an unknown boss. An accident causes Topo to lose his driver, and their car is taken to the police impound with the money still inside. Robbed of his money and his surrogate set of eyes, Topo takes Chloe and Sophia hostage.(n)

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day. One morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Emily Blunt, Lisa Kudrow, Justin Theroux and Allison Janney star.(n)

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: When a brilliant video game maker named Flynn (Jeff Bridges) hacks the mainframe of his ex-employer, he is beamed inside a digital world and becomes part of the very game he is designing.

programme.title: Clockstoppers
programme.desc: Sci-fi action highlights this breezy fantasy starring Jesse Bradford as Zak Gibbs, a high school student who "borrows" the latest invention of his scientist dad, a "hyper-time" device that impresses a pretty exchange student (Paula Garces) but also attracts the attention of a sinister government agent (Michael Biehn). French Stewart and Julia Sweeney costar in this teen adventure in the tradition of "Back to the Future.".

programme.title: Last Girl Standing
programme.desc: Five years after surviving a brutal massacre, the lone survivor struggles to reclaim her shattered life. But just when she thinks she might finally be ready to start anew, the past comes back to haunt her.

programme.title: The Funhouse Massacre
programme.desc: On Halloween night, a group of notorious serial killers escape from an asylum and terrorize the patrons of a funhouse carnival - leaving only a rag-tag bunch of kids, a clueless deputy and a local sheriff to stop the carnage.

programme.title: The Golden Child
programme.desc: As The Chosen One, Eddie Murphy is on a madcap mission to save The Golden Child, a youth with mystical powers who's been abducted by an evil cult. He battles a band of henchmen, scrambles through a booby-trapped chamber of horrors and traverses Tibet to obtain a sacred dagger. But it's his wit that turns out to be his sharpest weapon.

programme.title: Tron
programme.desc: When a brilliant video game maker named Flynn (Jeff Bridges) hacks the mainframe of his ex-employer, he is beamed inside a digital world and becomes part of the very game he is designing.

programme.title: King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table
programme.desc: Facing defeat, Merlin banishes the evil enchantress Morgana and her son to the ends of universe. Vowing revenge, Morgana and her son return to Earth, hell-bent on destroying every last descendant of King Arthur and his Knights.

programme.title: Capsule
programme.desc: In 1959, during the height of the Cold War, an experienced fighter pilot finds himself trapped in a malfunctioning spacecraft and must fight to survive in order to make it home to Earth.

programme.title: Dune
programme.desc: On distant planets, a royal messiah has been born who will restore order to the universe, but there are forces that don't want evil to be vanquished!

programme.title: The Pact
programme.desc: Nicole and Annie reluctantly return to their childhood home to pay their respects after their mother passes away. While staying overnight in the house, the sisters sense a mysterious presence in their midst - noises startling them in the night, objects moving about, a fallen picture of an unknown woman posed next to their mother. Annie begins experiencing a series of intense & disturbing dreams, and ­visions that lead to her mother's past finally revealing itself.

programme.title: Jackals
programme.desc: When Justin Powell (Ben Sullivan) is captured by two ski-masked men and dragged back to a secluded cabin, it's anything but a standard kidnapping. Waiting for Justin at the cabin are his father (Johnathon Schaech) mother (Deborah Kara Unger), brother (Nick Roux) and former girlfriend (Chelsea Ricketts). Together, they attempt to free him from the sinister brainwashing he's undergone at the hands of a vicious cult known as The Jackals.

programme.title: Intruders
programme.desc: An agoraphobic woman is isolated from human contact in every way and that is exactly how she likes it. But when a trio of criminals breaks into her old Victorian house on the outskirts of town, they discover there's another side to her psychosis.

programme.title: It Stains The Sands Red
programme.desc: In the throes of a zombie apocalypse, Molly - a troubled woman from Las Vegas with a dark past - finds herself stranded in the desert with a ravenous zombie on her tail. At first, she's easily able to outpace her undead pursuer, but things quickly become worse when she realizes the zombie doesn't need to ever stop and rest. Running low on supplies and beat down by the harsh environment, Molly must summon strength she never knew she had in order to face it.

programme.title: Encino Man
programme.desc: Two high school buddies dig up a frozen caveman in their backyard. Once the living fossil thaws out, the friends realize he's their ticket to being cool. Starring Pauly Shore, Sean Astin and Brendan Fraser.

programme.title: Blood and Chocolate
programme.desc: A teenage werewolf living in Bucharest falls in love with a visiting American artist and threatens the future of her entire species by pursuing the romance. Agnes Brucker, Hugh Dancy and Olivier Martinez star in this ominous, supernatural love story based on the novel by Annette Curtis Klause.

programme.title: The Illusionist
programme.desc: Set in early 20th-century Vienna, a stage magician uses his magic to win back the great love of his life from a brutal enemy, her fiancé, who is also the powerful crowned prince of Austria. Stars Edward Norton, Paul Giamatti and Jessica Biel.

programme.title: Outlander
programme.desc: It's Vikings versus a dragon-like alien beast after an extraterrestrial spacecraft crashes in an 8th-century Norwegian lake. James Caviezel, Sophia Myles and John Hurt star in this imaginative science fiction action thriller.

programme.title: The Scarehouse
programme.desc: Two years after a tragic accident, six girls are invited to a party inside an elaborate Halloween funhouse. Once inside, they realize the true purpose of the event: to torture them as part of a revenge scheme. Corey and Elaina have spent their entire time in jail planning the elaborate payback since being solely blamed for the accident two years prior. As the night goes on, they all realize there is more to the scandal and cover-up than previously thought.

programme.title: Contracted
programme.desc: Samantha (Townsend) is a twenty‐something party girl with little discipline and even less direction. After experiencing a lapse in her relationship with her lover (Stegeman), she's forced to move back in with her overbearing mother (Williams). Things take a turn for the worse when she spends the night with a mysterious man (Barrett), leaving her hung‐over and guilt‐ridden. However, something else is wrong with Samantha and she's infected. Unsure of the disease, she realizes she is the host of something catastrophic.

programme.title: Dune
programme.desc: On distant planets, a royal messiah has been born who will restore order to the universe, but there are forces that don't want evil to be vanquished!

programme.title: Casper
programme.desc: A paranormal expert moves into an abandoned house. It's populated by three mischievous ghosts and one friendly one named Casper, who befriends his lonely daughter named Kat. Bill Pullman and Christina Ricci star.

programme.title: Separated
programme.desc: In this short film, a wind-up toy robot goes on an epic journey to save his better half.

programme.title: Cold Souls
programme.desc: Paul Giamatti stars in this surreal comedy as an actor paralyzed by anxiety who decides to have his soul extracted by a high-tech company in order to alleviate his suffering but complications ensue when a mysterious soul-trafficking mule steals his soul and takes it to Russia.

programme.title: At the Devil's Door
programme.desc: When ambitious young real estate agent Leigh is asked to sell a house with a checkered past, she crosses paths with a disturbed girl whom she learns is the runaway daughter of the couple selling the property. Leigh tries to intervene and help her, but becomes entangled with a supernatural force that pulls Leigh's sister Vera into its web, and has sinister plans for both of them. Starring Naya Rivera, Ashley Rickards and Catalina Sandino Moreno.

programme.title: Extraterrestrial
programme.desc: A group's getaway into the woods dissolves into a full-throttle fight for their lives when unwelcome aliens invade.

programme.title: The Caretaker
programme.desc: When a young woman moves into a large Victorian home to become the caretaker to her aging, sickly grandmother, she soon finds herself sleepwalking and having strange visions and is forced to confront her family's darkest secrets before the evil presence in the house overtakes her sanity.

programme.title: Devil's Pass
programme.desc: Nine Russian hikers venture into a remote area of the Ural Mountains. Two weeks later, all nine are found dead. Five ambitious American college students are issued a grant to return to the site of the original events in the belief that they can uncover and document the truth of what happened. Their trek through the mountains, retracing the steps of that ill-fated journey, is plagued by strange and increasingly terrifying phenomena, all of which suggest that they are not alone. The forces behind the Dyatlov Pass Incident are waiting for them.

programme.title: Cold Souls
programme.desc: Paul Giamatti stars in this surreal comedy as an actor paralyzed by anxiety who decides to have his soul extracted by a high-tech company in order to alleviate his suffering but complications ensue when a mysterious soul-trafficking mule steals his soul and takes it to Russia.

programme.title: Extraterrestrial
programme.desc: A group's getaway into the woods dissolves into a full-throttle fight for their lives when unwelcome aliens invade.

programme.title: At the Devil's Door
programme.desc: When ambitious young real estate agent Leigh is asked to sell a house with a checkered past, she crosses paths with a disturbed girl whom she learns is the runaway daughter of the couple selling the property. Leigh tries to intervene and help her, but becomes entangled with a supernatural force that pulls Leigh's sister Vera into its web, and has sinister plans for both of them. Starring Naya Rivera, Ashley Rickards and Catalina Sandino Moreno.(n)

programme.title: Don't Sleep
programme.desc: Shawn and Zach are young lovers who move into a guesthouse together on an estate owned by Mr. and Mrs. Marino. When bizarre events begin to occur, Zach slowly remembers a forgotten time in his childhood when he suffered from severe and violent psychosis - memories erased by a series of electroconvulsive shock treatments administered by his psychiatrist. As the terrors surrounding their lives grow to deadly proportions, Zach is forced to question his own sanity.(n)

programme.title: Hardcore Henry
programme.desc: In the world's first action-adventure film shot entirely from a first person perspective, a resurrected cyborg named Henry must fight through the streets of Moscow in pursuit of his kidnapped wife.(n)

programme.title: The Babadook
programme.desc: Six years after the violent death of her husband, Amelia (Essie Davis) is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her out-of-control son, Samuel (Noah Wiseman), who she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house, Samuel is convinced that the Babadook is the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control, he becomes more unpredictable and violent.(n)

programme.title: The Caretaker
programme.desc: When a young woman moves into a large Victorian home to become the caretaker to her aging, sickly grandmother, she soon finds herself sleepwalking and having strange visions and is forced to confront her family's darkest secrets before the evil presence in the house overtakes her sanity.(n)

programme.title: Don't Sleep
programme.desc: Shawn and Zach are young lovers who move into a guesthouse together on an estate owned by Mr. and Mrs. Marino. When bizarre events begin to occur, Zach slowly remembers a forgotten time in his childhood when he suffered from severe and violent psychosis - memories erased by a series of electroconvulsive shock treatments administered by his psychiatrist. As the terrors surrounding their lives grow to deadly proportions, Zach is forced to question his own sanity.(n)

programme.title: Clockstoppers
programme.desc: Sci-fi action highlights this breezy fantasy starring Jesse Bradford as Zak Gibbs, a high school student who "borrows" the latest invention of his scientist dad, a "hyper-time" device that impresses a pretty exchange student (Paula Garces) but also attracts the attention of a sinister government agent (Michael Biehn). French Stewart and Julia Sweeney costar in this teen adventure in the tradition of "Back to the Future.".(n)

programme.title: Mission to Mars
programme.desc: In the year 2020, the first manned mission to Mars, commanded by Luke Graham (Don Cheadle), lands safely on the red planet, but is soon met with catastrophe. Haunted by a cryptic last message from Graham, NASA launches the Mars Recovery Mission to investigate and bring back survivors. Confronted with nearly insurmountable dangers, but propelled by deep friendship, the team finally lands on Mars and makes a discovery that explains everything.(n)

programme.title: The Boy
programme.desc: A young woman (Lauren Cohan) takes a job as a nanny in a remote English village and soon discovers the family child is a life-sized doll - cared for like a real child as a way to cope with the death of their son 20 years prior.(n)

programme.title: The Darkest Hour
programme.desc: Five young people find themselves stranded in Moscow, fighting to survive in the wake of a devastating alien attack in this sci-fi action thriller directed by Chris Gorak. Starring Emile Hirsch and Oliva Thirlby.(n)

programme.title: Refuge
programme.desc: Post-apocalyptic thriller set in the ruins of a collapsed America where a family struggles to survive and rebuild a life in the wake of a catastrophic plague that has wiped out most of the surrounding civilization. When they take in an injured young man, it may threaten everything they have.(n)

programme.title: Muhammad Ali: The Greatest. Of All Time.
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, after his recent and high profile defeat to Larry Holmes, boxing legend Muhammad Ali takes it upon himself to talk a suicidal stranger down from a ledge. Using his unique brand of wit and wisdom, he succeeds in persuading the man that life is worth living, and learns a huge amount about himself in the process. Starring Noel Clarke as Muhammad Ali, Osy Ikhile as Joe, Lucian Msamati as Herbert Muhammad and Danny John-Jules as Don King.(n)

programme.title: Would You Rather
programme.desc: After the tragic death of her parents, Iris (Brittany Snow) is desperate to make ends meet while caring for her terminally ill younger brother. Shepard Lambrick (Jeffrey Combs), a philanthropist who expresses interest in helping them, invites her to an exclusive dinner party. When she arrives, she finds herself among a group of similarly desperate individuals. They are all trapped in Lambrick's mansion and forced to play a sadistic game where only the winner will get out alive.(n)

programme.title: Mission to Mars
programme.desc: In the year 2020, the first manned mission to Mars, commanded by Luke Graham (Don Cheadle), lands safely on the red planet, but is soon met with catastrophe. Haunted by a cryptic last message from Graham, NASA launches the Mars Recovery Mission to investigate and bring back survivors. Confronted with nearly insurmountable dangers, but propelled by deep friendship, the team finally lands on Mars and makes a discovery that explains everything.(n)

programme.title: Attack of the Killer Donuts
programme.desc: A chemical accident turns ordinary donuts into bloodthirsty monsters and three friends must track them down as they begin eating their victims. It's up to them to destroy the donuts and save their sleepy little town.(n)

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.

programme.title: Arsenal
programme.desc: Family loyalty is tested when a successful businessman (Adrian Grenier) is willing to do anything for his deadbeat brother (Johnathon Schaech) — including tracking down the vicious mobster (Nicolas Cage) holding him hostage.

programme.title: Battle Scars
programme.desc: Luke Stephens (Zane Holtz) shows up on his brother Nicky's (Ryan Eggold) doorstep after a tour of duty in Afghanistan. Suffering from both Post Traumatic Stress Disorder and physical wounds that are unseen, Luke wants nothing more than to forget the war, but his veteran father (David James Elliott) won't let him. Then, at a local strip club run by a ruthless killer, Luke crosses paths with Michelle (Heather McComb), who leads him into a violent world every bit as dangerous as the brutality he is trying to leave behind.

programme.title: Last Night
programme.desc: Michael and Joanna Reed (Sam Worthington and Keira Knightley) seem to have it all. Young, attractive and successful, they're a married couple who've lucked into spiritual and material well-being, sharing a comfortable life in their trendy Manhattan apartment. But when they attend one of Michael's work parties, Joanna witnesses a suspicious moment between her husband and his beautiful new co-worker, Laura (Eva Mendes). Joanna can't be sure what she did or didn't see - but it sows a powerful seed of doubt.

programme.title: B&B
programme.desc: Marc and Fred go to war when they are refused a double bed at a Christian B&B. They win their court case and go back. Triumph turns to terror when a Russian neo-Nazi checks in. Their weekend of fun becomes a bloody battle.

programme.title: Certain Women
programme.desc: Michelle Williams, Kristen Stewart and Laura Dern star as three women striving to forge their own paths amidst the wide-open plains of the American Northwest. The lawyer (Dern) finds herself contending with both office sexism and a hostage situation. The wife and mother (Williams) has determination to build her dream home which puts her at odds with the men in her life. The young law student (Stewart) forms an ambiguous bond with a lonely ranch hand (Lily Gladstone).

programme.title: Devil's Pass
programme.desc: Nine Russian hikers venture into a remote area of the Ural Mountains. Two weeks later, all nine are found dead. Five ambitious American college students are issued a grant to return to the site of the original events in the belief that they can uncover and document the truth of what happened. Their trek through the mountains, retracing the steps of that ill-fated journey, is plagued by strange and increasingly terrifying phenomena, all of which suggest that they are not alone. The forces behind the Dyatlov Pass Incident are waiting for them.

programme.title: Shot
programme.desc: Three lives are irrevocably changed when a gun is accidentally fired on a busy LA street. Mark (Noah Wyle) and Phoebe (Sharon Leal) are in the midst of a breakup. Miguel (Jorge Lendeborg, Jr.), a bullied teenager, is given an illegal gun by his cousin for protection. As Miguel handles it, the gun accidently fires and Mark is hit by the bullet.

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: Successful suburbanite commuter Howard Wakefield (Bryan Cranston) takes a perverse detour from family life by vanishing without a trace. Hidden in the attic of his carriage house garage and surviving by scavenging at night, Howard secretly observes the lives of his wife (Jennifer Garner) and children and neighbors. He slowly realizes that he has not left his family, he has left himself.

programme.title: A Rising Tide
programme.desc: After the destruction of his family's restaurant during Hurricane Sandy, a young chef (Hunter Parrish) must grow up quickly, taking the biggest risks of his life both in business and love. Life starts to go his way when he meets a wealthy patron (Tim Daly) and has a chance encounter with Sarah (Ashley Hinshaw). As a chain of unexpected events unfolds for all of them, as they discover the only way to achieve their dreams may be to acknowledge what they owe to others - and let destiny take its course.

programme.title: Blackway
programme.desc: Revenge thriller starring Anthony Hopkins as a man haunted by the memory of his daughter's death, who comes to the aid of a young woman who is being viciously harassed by a rogue cop. Co-stars Julia Stiles and Ray Liotta.

programme.title: Cold Comes the Night
programme.desc: As the proprietor of a motel, Chloe is in financial trouble and has quietly allowed a prostitution operation to run on the premises. One night, Topo (Bryan Cranston), a nearly-blind career criminal, and his driver stop over at the motel while en route to deliver cash to an unknown boss. An accident causes Topo to lose his driver, and their car is taken to the police impound with the money still inside. Robbed of his money and his surrogate set of eyes, Topo takes Chloe and Sophia hostage.

programme.title: The Condemned
programme.desc: Ten killers sentenced to death for their murderous crimes are flown to a remote island and pitted against each other in a lethal series of fights, with the ultimate victor winning his freedom as the grand prize. Steve Austin, Vinnie Jones, Robert Mammone and Rick Hoffman star in this bone-cracking, hard-driving action thriller.

programme.title: Wakefield
programme.desc: Successful suburbanite commuter Howard Wakefield (Bryan Cranston) takes a perverse detour from family life by vanishing without a trace. Hidden in the attic of his carriage house garage and surviving by scavenging at night, Howard secretly observes the lives of his wife (Jennifer Garner) and children and neighbors. He slowly realizes that he has not left his family, he has left himself.

programme.title: Madea's Family Reunion
programme.desc: Writer, director and star Tyler Perry returns to his signature role in this comedy-drama that finds family matriarch Madea juggling several romantic crises involving her nieces' relationships as well as the funeral of an older sister - all on the weekend that her entire clan is gathering for a reunion. Cicely Tyson, Blair Underwood, Lynn Whitfield and Maya Angelou costar.

programme.title: Crossroads
programme.desc: Pop music sensation Britney Spears stars in this teen road-trip drama about a trio of high school pals that heads for the bright lights of Los Angeles, meeting up with both romance and loss along the way. Zoe Saldana, Taryn Manning, Anson Mount, Dan Aykroyd and Kim Cattrall costar in this film from director Tamra Davis ("Billy Madison").

programme.title: Rolling Stones: Sweet Summer Sun - Hyde Park Live
programme.desc: The biggest live show of the year: The Rolling Stones return to Hyde Park, London almost 44 years to the day after their legendary free concert in July 1969. Featuring their greatest hits across a career spanning 50 years, plus a special appearance by former Stones guitarist Mick Taylor. Highlights include 'Gimme Shelter,' 'Jumpin' Jack Flash,' 'You Can't Always Get What You Want' and '(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction.'.

programme.title: Bad Ass 2: Bad Asses
programme.desc: In this buddy drama, a Vietnam vet and his grumpy yet lovable sidekick team up to find the killer of a young boxer and clean up the streets of LA only to be drawn into an international crime ring. Stars Danny Trejo and Danny Glover.

programme.title: Nocturne
programme.desc: Isaac intends to throw the greatest graduation party of all time while his parents are out of town. Instead, he is disappointed to find that only a handful of his friends show up. Intent on making the best of the night, the group performs a séance to learn more about the futures that lie before them. The seemingly innocent game goes terribly wrong and they soon find that they are not alone in the house. Something has joined the party, and it wants them dead.

programme.title: Body
programme.desc: After three twenty-something girls break into a mansion and inadvertently murder the groundskeeper, they slowly self-destruct as they decide what to do with the dead body in the living room.

programme.title: The Beach Boys: Making Pet Sounds
programme.desc: Celebrating the 50th anniversary of the release of ‘Pet Sounds,' Brian Wilson and surviving members of The Beach Boys (Mike Love, Al Jardine, Bruce Johnston and David Marks) revisit the writing and recording of the landmark record that is consistently voted one of the top three influential albums of all time. Featuring exclusive interviews, classic archive and rare studio outtakes from the recording sessions.

programme.title: Pride
programme.desc: Terrence Howard stars in this rousing true-life story of a Philadelphia swim coach in the mid-1970s who faces racism in trying to land a coaching position, and instead transforms a group of trash-talking inner-city teenagers into a championship squad. Bernie Mac, Kimberly Elise and Tom Arnold costar in this inspiring drama.

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Without adopting the romantic and moralistic cliches that have crippled many other films about addiction, Gus Van Sant directs Matt Dillon, Kelly Lynch, James Le Gros and Heather Graham in one of the most influential films of the late 1980s. Bob (Dillon) is the leader of a small gang of junkies that robs pharmacies and hospitals for prescription drugs. Alas, Bob is now starting to feel the burden of responsibility as he watches over his band of misfits. Van Sant's joyous and exhilarating second feature is notable for its humor and bravery.

programme.title: Kelly & Cal
programme.desc: Juliette Lewis stars as a punk rocker turned suburban mom who is caught between a life she can no longer have and an uncertain future where she doesn't fit in, until she meets a frustrated 17-year-old boy and they strike up an unlikely friendship that alters both of their lives.

programme.title: My One and Only
programme.desc: After she catches her husband cheating on her, a charming, flamboyant socialite packs her two young sons into a Coupe de Ville and embarks on a cross-country journey to find a new head of the family. Renee Zellweger, Logan Lerman and Kevin Bacon star in this comedy-drama loosely based on a true story.

programme.title: Steve Byrne: Tell The Damn Joke
programme.desc: He's a comic. A husband. A dad. An American. And on top of it all, he's hilarious. Steve Byrne brings his signature style to Chicago with an all-new comedy special that holds no punches, calls it like it is and tells the damn jokes.

programme.title: Texas Rangers
programme.desc: A ragtag group of youngsters band together after the American Civil War to form the Texas Rangers, a group charged with the duty of cleaning up the West.

programme.title: The Girl On The Train
programme.desc: Rachel, who is devastated by her recent divorce, spends her daily commute fantasizing about the seemingly perfect couple who live in a house that her train passes every day. One morning she sees something shocking happen there and becomes entangled in the mystery that unfolds. Emily Blunt, Lisa Kudrow, Justin Theroux and Allison Janney star.

programme.title: Drugstore Cowboy
programme.desc: Without adopting the romantic and moralistic cliches that have crippled many other films about addiction, Gus Van Sant directs Matt Dillon, Kelly Lynch, James Le Gros and Heather Graham in one of the most influential films of the late 1980s. Bob (Dillon) is the leader of a small gang of junkies that robs pharmacies and hospitals for prescription drugs. Alas, Bob is now starting to feel the burden of responsibility as he watches over his band of misfits. Van Sant's joyous and exhilarating second feature is notable for its humor and bravery.

programme.title: Slow Burn (2007)
programme.desc: A district attorney who's running for mayor suddenly finds himself embroiled in a case of murder and financial corruption in this edgy thriller starring Ray Liotta, LL Cool J, Jolene Blalock, Mekhi Phifer, Taye Diggs and Chewitel Ejiofor.(n)

programme.title: Avenge the Crows: The Legend of Loca
programme.desc: The pendulum of revenge is set in motion when an assassin named Joker is released from prison. His orders from the Reyes Ricos prison gang are to take down Loca, an ex-gang member who once ran the powerful Los Grajos crew. Now Loca makes her living pushing drugs, and maintains a watchful eye on her young cousin, Cammy, the only family she has left. Although she is cunning and street smart, Loca doesn't see Joker coming, and he attacks Cammy to lure her out of hiding.(n)

programme.title: My Money
programme.desc: Our lives revolve around money. But a new world order is emerging, one with the power to create currency and bypass governments and regulation. In this episode, enter the world of digital money: from the recesses of the dark net marketplace to workers in China excavating a new form of money; to 'bitcoin miners' struggling to cope with a potentially volatile algorithm; to a young cam worker whose sexual fetishes link them all together.(n)

programme.title: Zack and Miri Make a Porno
programme.desc: As a way to pay off their mounting debts, lifelong pals Zack (Seth Rogen) and Miri (Elizabeth Banks) decide to write, direct and star in a pornographic movie, which they believe to be a sure moneymaker. But they may end up as the first couple in adult cinematic history that discovers long-hidden feelings for each other while doing so. Craig Robinson costars in this romantic sex comedy.(n)

programme.title: Don't Knock Twice
programme.desc: A successful sculptor named Jess returns to the UK to rebuild her relationship with Chloe, the daughter she was forced to give up nine years ago. When she agrees to come and live with her, Jess learns that Chloe has not come to stay because she wants to get to know her mother again. She has come because she is scared that a supernatural curse has claimed the life of her boyfriend, Danny, and is now coming for her. Chloe and Danny made the mistake of visiting an abandoned house once home to a witch, that comes for you if you knock on the door.(n)

programme.title: Pride
programme.desc: Terrence Howard stars in this rousing true-life story of a Philadelphia swim coach in the mid-1970s who faces racism in trying to land a coaching position, and instead transforms a group of trash-talking inner-city teenagers into a championship squad. Bernie Mac, Kimberly Elise and Tom Arnold costar in this inspiring drama.(n)

programme.title: Orny Adams: More Than Loud
programme.desc: In his new stand-up special, Orny Adams fluctuates between the relevant and the absurd, attacking what's wrong with the world and at times including what's wrong with him.(n)

programme.title: Risk
programme.desc: In the new world order where a single keystroke can alter history, WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is undeterred - even as the legal jeopardy he faces threatens to undermine the organization he leads and fracture the movement he inspired. Capturing this story with unprecedented access, Academy Award® winning director Laura Poitras finds herself caught between the motives and contradictions of Assange and his inner circle in a documentary portrait of power, betrayal, truth and sacrifice.(n)

programme.title: Shot
programme.desc: Three lives are irrevocably changed when a gun is accidentally fired on a busy LA street. Mark (Noah Wyle) and Phoebe (Sharon Leal) are in the midst of a breakup. Miguel (Jorge Lendeborg, Jr.), a bullied teenager, is given an illegal gun by his cousin for protection. As Miguel handles it, the gun accidently fires and Mark is hit by the bullet.(n)

programme.title: Middle School: The Worst Years of My Life
programme.desc: Rafe has an epic imagination and a slight problem with authority. When he transfers to a new school, Rafe and his scheming best friend Leo hatch a plan to break every rule in the school's code of conduct. This causes a battle with the principal, which explodes into chaos both real and imagined. Rafe struggles to hide his misbehavior from Jeanne, the straight-A, overachieving girl of his dreams, while at home, his mother's boyfriend - a moochy, jack-of-no-trades named Bear - threatens to become his stepfather.(n)

programme.title: Sister
programme.desc: After the death of his father, a young man whose life is falling apart, returns to his hometown to take care of his mentally ill sister, and tries to save her, while also saving himself.(n)

programme.title: Before I Fall
programme.desc: Sam (Zoey Deutch) seems to have everything a teenage girl could want: popularity, a hot boyfriend, cool status, fun friends, loving family and seeming happiness. But beyond the superficial, Sam's life isn't so charmed. She is one of a clique of high school mean girls who make life hell for those who are different. When Sam is killed in a car accident, she is forced to relive her last day on Earth seven times in order to get things right. She attempts to make sense of what befell her and gain a better understanding of herself and others.(n)

programme.title: The Space Between Us
programme.desc: Shortly after arriving to help colonize Mars, an astronaut dies while giving birth to the first human born on the red planet, unable to reveal who the father is. The child, Gardner Elliot, is an inquisitive, highly intelligent boy who reaches the age of 16 having only met 14 people in his life. While searching for clues about his father, and the home planet he's never known, Gardner begins an online friendship with a street-smart girl named Tulsa. He arrives on Earth, eager to experience all of the wonders he's only read about.(n)

programme.title: Sleepless
programme.desc: When Las Vegas cop Vincent Downs (Jamie Foxx) and his partner Sean (Tip "T.I." Harris) rob a cocaine shipment bound for a drug-dealing casino boss (Dermot Mulroney), the desperate businessman retaliates by kidnapping Vincent's son (Octavius J. Johnson). Pursued by a dogged Internal Affairs investigator (Michelle Monaghan) and a sadistic drug kingpin (Scoot McNairy), Vincent must rely on his street smarts and sheer force of will as he tries to rescue his child over the course of a single night. Directed by Baran bo Odar.(n)

programme.title: Bulletproof
programme.desc: Adam Sandler plays a small-time criminal who must be escorted to L.A. by an undercover cop (Damon Wayans). When their transport plane is shot down, Sandler and Wayans must make it across the country by themselves.(n)

programme.title: A Dog's Purpose
programme.desc: A devoted dog (voiced by Josh Gad) finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he teaches to laugh and love. Also starring Dennis Quaid, Britt Robertson, K.J. Apa, Peggy Lipton and Pooch Hall.

programme.title: The Sense of an Ending
programme.desc: Tony Webster (Jim Broadbent) lives a reclusive existence in London, until he learns that a diary has been left to him by the recently deceased mother (Emily Mortimer) of an ex-girlfriend (Charlotte Rampling). As Webster investigates the diary, he is forced to face the truth about his first love and the consequences of decisions made a lifetime ago, while attempting to resolve his strained relationships with his ex-wife (Harriet Walter) and their pregnant daughter (Michelle Dockery).

programme.title: Lord of War
programme.desc: Nicolas Cage stars in this drama thriller as Yuri Orlov, a Russian immigrant who becomes a millionaire in the Eighties and Nineties by reselling weapons from his politically crumbling homeland to "hot spot" regions around the world, all while marrying a beautiful woman (Bridget Moynahan), dodging a determined federal agent (Ethan Hawke), and occasionally facing the immorality of his chosen profession. Jared Leto and Ian Holm costar in this film from writer/director Andrew Niccol ("Gattaca," "The Truman Show").

programme.title: Play It to the Bone
programme.desc: Best buddies and sparring partners, Vince (Woody Harrelson) and Cesar (Antonio Banderas) are a pair of worn-out, over-the-hill prizefighters who jump at one last chance to work in the big time. They just have to get to Las Vegas first. When they finally step into the ring, friendship is replaced by fierce competition as Vince and Cesar tangle in a dramatic fight to the finish.

programme.title: The Light Between Oceans
programme.desc: Lighthouse keeper Tom Sherbourne (Michael Fassbender) and spirited Isabel (Alicia Vikander) live together in married bliss on a remote, rugged island off the coast of Australia. But their windswept world is turned upside down when Isabel learns that she's unable to bear a child. One day, a drifting lifeboat washes ashore with a crying baby in it. The dilemma the couple now faces echoes far beyond the island, engulfing and irrevocably impacting their world.

programme.title: Momma
programme.desc: A nine-year-old boy living in a trailer park carries on with his schoolwork and daily chores petrified at the thought of being taken away from his mother.

programme.title: Employee of the Month (2006)
programme.desc: A slacker box boy (Dane Cook) at a New Mexico superstore tries to impress a gorgeous new coworker (Jessica Simpson) by transforming himself into a model corporate drone, but runs up against the previous 17-time holder (Dax Shepard) of the store's "employee of the month" honor.

programme.title: Breach
programme.desc: Ryan Phillippe stars as an FBI agent assigned the job of doing surveillance on a senior agent whose sexual deviance may be compromising the agency. When he learns that his new boss is actually a spy, he becomes part of a massive sting operation to bring him to justice. Also starring Academy Award® winner Chris Cooper and Laura Linney.

programme.title: Crimson Tide
programme.desc: In the midst of a global crisis, the USS Alabama receives an unconfirmed order to launch its nuclear missiles - signaling the start of World War III. The tension quickly rises as the sub's respected commander (Gene Hackman) and his brilliant executive officer (Denzel Washington) clash over the validity of their orders, battling each other for control of the sub. Also starring Viggo Mortensen and James Gandolfini.

programme.title: Robocop
programme.desc: When an honest cop (Peter Weller) is killed in the line of duty, the embattled Detroit Police Department of the future brings him back to life as RoboCop, the latest in cyborg technology. Programmed to be the ultimate law enforcer, RoboCop's not supposed to remember his human past - but memories of life, love and family are flooding in, blurring the line between man and machine, even as RoboCop sweeps the streets of "scum." Nancy Allen, Kurtwood Smith and Ronny Cox costar in this sci-fi blockbuster.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 1
programme.desc: A woman emerges from a coma four years after taking a bullet to the head at her own wedding, and goes on an epic vendetta against her former boss and his deadly squad of international assassins in a kill or be-killed fight. Directed by Quentin Tarantino; stars Uma Thurman and Lucy Liu.

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to the Quentin Tarantino cult classic, a murderous bride continues her quest for vengeance against her former boss and lover and those who betrayed her, leading up to the ultimate confrontation with the man who ordered her execution. Stars Uma Thurman.

programme.title: Amistad
